step.context: \text{Given }\int f . g \,dx = f \int g\,dx - \int \left[f^{\prime}\int g\,dx\right].dx\\ \text{Which is the better choice for }f \left(x\right) \text{ and }g \left(x\right).
step.reason:
\text{Ideally, you want a }f \left(x\right) \text{ whose }f^{\prime} \left(x\right)\text{ is simpler}\\ \text{In this case, }f \left(x\right) = x \left(\text{ and }g \left(x\right) = \sin^3 x\right)\text{ is the}\\ \text{better choice.Or you can use a good thumb rule}\\ \text{called ILATE i.e. }f \left(x\right)\text{ is the function that}\\ \text{matches first.}\\
\begin{tabular}{|C|C|} \hline I & \text{Inverse trigonometric functions}\\ L & \text{Logrithmic functions} \\ A & \text{Algebric functions} \\ T & \text{Trigonometic functions} \\ E & \text{Exponential functions} \\ \hline \end{tabular}

step.context: \text{Given }f \left(x\right) = x \text{ and }g \left(x\right) =\sin 3x\text{, what will}\\ \text{Integral evaluate to?}
